member.summary: Checks whether the current event is of the specified type.

member.summary: Checks whether the current event is of the specified type. If the event is of the specified type, returns it and moves to the next event. Otherwise retruns null.
member.returns: Returns the current event if it is of type T; otherwise returns null.

member.summary: Gets the next event without consuming it.
member.returns: Returns the current event if it is of type T; otherwise returns null.

member.name: T:SharpYaml.Serialization.ObjectContext
member.summary: The object context used when serializing/deserializing an object instance. See remarks.

remarks.para: When serializing, this struct contains the of the object to serialize, the type, the tag to use and the style, as well as providing access to the .

When deserializing, this struct will contain the expected type to deserialize and if not null, the instance of an object that will recieve deserialization of its members (in case the instance cannot be created).

member.name: T:SharpYaml.Schemas.CoreSchema
member.summary: Implements the Core schema.
member.remarks: The Core schema is an extension of the JSON schema, allowing for more human-readable presentation of the same types. This is the recommended default schema that YAML processor should use unless instructed otherwise. It is also strongly recommended that other schemas should be based on it.

members.member:
Implements a JSON schema.
The JSON schema is the lowest common denominator of most modern computer languages, and allows parsing JSON files. A YAML processor should therefore support this schema, at least as an option. It is also strongly recommended that other schemas should be based on it. . >

member.name: T:SharpYaml.Schemas.FailsafeSchema
member.summary: Implements the YAML failsafe schema.
member.remarks: The failsafe schema is guaranteed to work with any YAML document. It is therefore the recommended schema for generic YAML tools. A YAML processor should therefore support this schema, at least as an option.

member.name: T:SharpYaml.Schemas.SchemaBase
member.summary: Base implementation for a based schema.

member.summary: Provides schema information for tag resolution.

member.summary: Transforms the object after it has been read. This method is called after an object has been read and before returning the object to the deserialization process. See remarks for usage.
member.returns: The actual object deserialized. By default same as .
member.remarks: This method is usefull in conjunction with . For example, in the case of deserializing to an immutable member, where we need to call the constructor of a type instead of setting each of its member, we can instantiate a mutable object in , receive the mutable object filled in and transform it back to an immutable object.

summary.para: Specify the way to store a property or field of some class or structure.

member.name: F:SharpYaml.Serialization.SerializeMemberMode.Default
member.summary: Use the default mode depending on the type of the field/property.

member.name: F:SharpYaml.Serialization.SerializeMemberMode.Assign
member.summary: When restored, new object is created by using the parameters in the YAML data and assigned to the property / field. When the property / filed is writeable, this is the default.

member.name: F:SharpYaml.Serialization.SerializeMemberMode.Content
member.summary: Only valid for a property / field that has a class or struct type. When restored, instead of recreating the whole class or struct, the members are independently restored. When the property / field is not writeable this is the default.

member.name: F:SharpYaml.Serialization.SerializeMemberMode.Binary
member.summary: Only valid for a property / field that has an array type of a some value type. The content of the array is stored in a binary format encoded in base64 style.

member.name: F:SharpYaml.Serialization.SerializeMemberMode.Never
member.summary: The property / field will not be stored.

member.name: P:SharpYaml.Serialization.SerializerSettings.PreferredIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the preferred indentation. Default is 2.

member.name: P:SharpYaml.Serialization.SerializerSettings.EmitAlias
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to emit anchor alias. Default is true.
member.value: true to emit anchor alias; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:SharpYaml.Serialization.SerializerSettings.EmitTags
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to emit tags when serializing. Default is true.
member.value: true to emit tags when serializing; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:SharpYaml.Serialization.SerializerSettings.IndentLess
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the identation is trying to less indent when possible (For example, sequence after a key are not indented). Default is false.

member.name: P:SharpYaml.Serialization.SerializerSettings.SortKeyForMapping
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable sorting keys from dictionary to YAML mapping. Default is true. See remarks.
member.value: true to enable sorting keys from dictionary to YAML mapping; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: When storing a YAML document, It can be important to keep the same order for key mapping in order to keep a YAML document versionable/diffable.

member.name: P:SharpYaml.Serialization.SerializerSettings.EmitJsonComptible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to emit JSON compatible YAML.
member.value: true if to emit JSON compatible YAML; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:SharpYaml.Serialization.SerializerSettings.EmitCapacityForList
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the property should be emitted. Default is false.
member.value: true if the property should be emitted; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:SharpYaml.Serialization.SerializerSettings.LimitPrimitiveFlowSequence
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of elements an array/list of primitive can be emitted as a flow sequence (instead of a block sequence by default). Default is 0, meaning block style for all sequuences.

member.name: P:SharpYaml.Serialization.SerializerSettings.EmitDefaultValues
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to emit default value. Default is false.
member.value: true if to emit default value; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:SharpYaml.Serialization.SerializerSettings.ComparerForKeySorting
member.summary: Gets or sets the default key comparer used to sort members () or dictionary keys, when serializing objects as YAML mappings. Default is . To disable the default comparer, this value can be set to null.

member.name: P:SharpYaml.Serialization.SerializerSettings.EmitShortTypeName
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to emit short type name (type, assembly name) or full . Default is false.
member.value: true to emit short type name; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:SharpYaml.Serialization.SerializerSettings.DefaultStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the default . Default is . See to understand the resolution of styles.

member.name: P:SharpYaml.Serialization.SerializerSettings.SpecialCollectionMember
member.summary:
Gets or sets the prefix used to serialize items for a non pure or
. Default to "~Items", see remarks.
member.exception: Expecting length >= 2 and at least a special character '.', '~', '-' (not starting on first char for '-')
member.remarks: A pure or is a class that inherits from these types but are not adding any public properties or fields. When these types are pure, they are respectively serialized as a YAML mapping (for dictionary) or a YAML sequence (for collections). If the collection type to serialize is not pure, the type is serialized as a YAML mapping sequence that contains the public properties/fields as well as a special fielx (e.g. "~Items") that contains the actual items of the collection (either a mapping for dictionary or a sequence for collections). The is this special key that is used when serializing items of a non-pure collection.

member.summary: Gets or sets the default factory to instantiate a type. Default is .

member.summary: Gets or sets the schema. Default is . method.
